description: The LVGroupCompare function is an application-defined callback function used with the LVM_INSERTGROUPSORTED and LVM_SORTGROUPS messages. It defines the ordering of the groups, based on the ID. The  			LVGROUPCOMPARE type defines a pointer to this callback function. LVGroupCompare is a placeholder for the application-defined function name.
return_value: Type: INT Returns a negative value if the data for Group1_ID is less than the data for Group2_ID, a positive value if it is greater, or zero if it is the same.
name: LVGroupCompare

arguments.name: Group1_ID
arguments.description: Type: INT The ID of the first group.

arguments.name: Group2_ID
arguments.description: Type: INT The ID of the second group.

arguments.name: pvData
arguments.description: Type: VOID* A pointer to the application-defined information. This comes from the message that was called; for LVM_INSERTGROUPSORTED it is LVINSERTGROUPSORTED.pvData, and for LVM_SORTGROUPS it is the plv parameter.
